definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: Stop defeusinging regarding the bush. Will you quit or not?
sentences.chinese: 别拐弯儿抹角了，你到底戒不戒烟？
别拐弯儿抹角了，你到底戒不戒烟？

sentences.english: He has not quit smoking, but is holding down to three cigarettes a day.
sentences.chinese: 他并戒烟，已减到每天只抽三支烟了。

sentences.english: Four in 10 smokers tried to quit smoking in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 而在过去的一年中，四成吸烟者曾试图戒烟。

sentences.english: It's hard for a chain-smoker to leave off smoking.
sentences.chinese: 烟不离口的人很难戒烟。

sentences.english: I. The smoke-quitting product Habit-breaking Drink for Smokers provided by Party A shall be qualified products.
sentences.chinese: 甲方确保提供的君益忘烟饮戒烟产品为行货正品。

sentences.english: Never have there been so many tools, systems, and programs available for quitting smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从未有过如此众多的工具，制度和程序可用于戒烟。

sentences.english: Choose a close friend to help you through the white-knuckle times of this journey.
sentences.chinese: 找个好朋友一起戒烟有助于度过这难熬的过程。

sentences.english: Before announcing his presidential candidacy, he began a well-publicized effort to quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 宣布竞选总统之前，他向民众表示自己会戒烟。

sentences.english: I plan to quit drinking, smoking and gambling so that I can make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 我准备戒烟戒酒戒赌，以达到收支平衡。

sentences.english: Flags don't make very good fathers.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲终能永远戒烟了。

sentences.english: I have quitted smoking for more than one year.
I tryed very hard to persuade him to quit smoking,but to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 我说服他戒烟，但却白费力气。

sentences.english: In Canada, there are now more ex-smokers than there are smokers.
sentences.chinese: 目前在加拿大，戒烟者的人数多于吸烟者。

sentences.english: None of this means that anxious smokers who want to stop are without recourse.
sentences.chinese: 以上这些都不能说明急切戒烟者想戒烟的话别无他法。

definition: to give up drinking/to abstain from drinking
to quit/to give up (a bad habit)
to resume smoking (after giving up)/to relapse into smoking or drug abuse
to kick a drug habit/to abstain from drugs
to ban smoking/to quit smoking/to prohibit cooking/prohibition on opium (esp. in China from 1729)
